Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: Senior OpenAI leaders, including Mr. Sutskever, who is deeply concerned that A.I. could one day destroy humanity, later discussed whether Ms. Toner should be removed, a person involved in the conversations said.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: a person involved in the conversations

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: After vetting four candidates for one position, the remaining directors couldn’t agree on who should fill it, said the two people familiar with the board’s deliberations.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: the two people familiar with the board’s deliberations

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: The stalemate hardened the divide between Mr. Altman and Mr. Brockman and other board members.

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: In the email, Mr. Altman said that he had reprimanded Ms. Toner for the paper and that it was dangerous to the company, particularly at a time, he added, when the Federal Trade Commission was investigating OpenAI over the data used to build its technology.
Document Sources.Source Justification: an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Mr. Altman complained that the research paper seemed to criticize OpenAI’s efforts to keep its A.I. technologies safe while praising the approach taken by Anthropic, a company that has become OpenAI’s biggest rival, according to an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: according to an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Ms. Toner defended it as an academic paper that analyzed the challenges that the public faces when trying to understand the intentions of the countries and companies developing A.I.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: He signed a letter with other employees that demanded the independent directors resign.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: who had worked closely with Mr. Altman at OpenAI for eight years

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The confrontation between Mr. Sutskever and Ms. Brockman was reported earlier by The Wall Street Journal.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: “After a series of reasonably amicable negotiations, the co-founders of Anthropic were able to negotiate their exit on mutually agreeable terms,” an Anthropic spokeswoman, Sally Aldous, said.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: a company that has become OpenAI’s biggest rival

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: In a second statement, Anthropic added that there was “no attempt to ‘oust’ Sam Altman at the time the founders of Anthropic left OpenAI.”
